data.title: Woodburn Circle Society
data.meta_description: This is our most prestigious donor recognition group for those making gifts of $250,000 or more.
data.text:
The Woodburn Circle Society is the West Virginia University Foundation’s most prestigious recognition society comprised of four levels: Monticola, Woodburn, Martin and Chitwood. The Society recognizes living donors who have made cumulative gifts or pledges from July 1-June 30 of $250,000 or more to benefit the University and its affiliated organizations.

The gift commitment may be satisfied through any combination of the following:

Outright gifts from an individual of cash, securities, real property or gifts-in-kind, also gifts from an individual’s wholly owned company, family foundation, donor advised fund or other giving entity

Corporate matching gifts

Irrevocable income-producing gifts (unitrust, annuity trust, gift annuity or deferred gift annuity)

Life insurance policy gifts (where WVUF is the owner), and real estate remainder gifts (with a retained life estates for the donors)

Bequests, testamentary retirement asset gifts, “payable on death” accounts and beneficiary designations of life insurance.

Four recognition levels exist within the Society based on the member’s giving:

Gifts of $5 million or more - Monticola

Gifts of $1 million to $4,999,999 – Woodburn

Gifts of $500,000 to $999,999 – Martin

Gifts of $250,000 to $499,999 – Chitwood
